FlowGraph
Table of Contents

Class Graph

Namespace
FlowGraph.Core
Assembly
FlowGraph.Core.dll

Represents a flow graph containing nodes, edges, and other canvas elements. Provides methods for adding, removing, and querying graph elements.

public class Graph

Remarks

The Graph class uses the canvas-first architecture where the Elements collection is the single source of truth. All element types (nodes, edges, shapes, etc.) are stored in this unified collection.

Nodes and Edges provide typed read-only views into Elements for convenience when working with graph-specific operations.

Subscribe to Elements.CollectionChanged for all element changes, or use the convenience events NodesChanged and EdgesChanged for type-specific notifications.

Constructors

Graph()

Initializes a new instance of the Graph class.

public Graph()

Properties

Edges

Gets a read-only view of all edge elements.

public IReadOnlyList<Edge> Edges { get; }

Property Value

IReadOnlyList<Edge>

Remarks

This is a live view into Elements. To add/remove edges, use AddEdge(Edge), AddEdges(IEnumerable<Edge>), RemoveEdge(string), or modify Elements directly.

Elements

Gets the collection of all canvas elements (nodes, edges, shapes, etc.). This is the single source of truth for all graph elements.

public ElementCollection Elements { get; }

Property Value

ElementCollection

Remarks

Subscribe to Elements.CollectionChanged for change notifications. Use typed accessors Nodes and Edges for read-only typed access.

IsBatchLoading

Gets whether the graph is currently in batch loading mode. During batch loading, edge validation is skipped.

public bool IsBatchLoading { get; }

Property Value

bool

Nodes

Gets a read-only view of all node elements.

public IReadOnlyList<Node> Nodes { get; }

Property Value

IReadOnlyList<Node>

Remarks

This is a live view into Elements. To add/remove nodes, use AddNode(Node), AddNodes(IEnumerable<Node>), RemoveNode(string), or modify Elements directly.

SelectNodesInArea(Rect, bool)

Selects all nodes that intersect with the specified rectangular area.

public IReadOnlyList<Node> SelectNodesInArea(Rect bounds, bool fullyContained = false)

Parameters

bounds Rect

The rectangular area in canvas coordinates.

fullyContained bool

If true, only selects nodes fully contained within the bounds. If false (default), selects nodes that intersect with the bounds.

Returns

IReadOnlyList<Node>

The list of nodes that were selected.

UnselectNodesInArea(Rect, bool)

Unselects all nodes that intersect with the specified rectangular area.

public IReadOnlyList<Node> UnselectNodesInArea(Rect bounds, bool fullyContained = false)

Parameters

bounds Rect

The rectangular area in canvas coordinates.

fullyContained bool

If true, only unselects nodes fully contained within the bounds. If false (default), unselects nodes that intersect with the bounds.

Returns

IReadOnlyList<Node>

The list of nodes that were unselected.

Events

BatchLoadCompleted

Event raised when batch loading completes. Subscribe to this to refresh UI after bulk operations.

public event EventHandler? BatchLoadCompleted

Event Type

EventHandler

EdgesChanged

Event raised when edges are added, removed, or the collection is reset. This is a convenience event derived from Elements.CollectionChanged.

public event NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler? EdgesChanged

Event Type

NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler

NodeBoundsChanged

Event raised when any node's bounds (position or size) change. Uses lazy subscription - only subscribes to individual node events when this event has subscribers. Ideal for spatial index invalidation and layout systems.

public event EventHandler<NodeBoundsChangedEventArgs>? NodeBoundsChanged

Event Type

EventHandler<NodeBoundsChangedEventArgs>

Remarks

This event uses a lazy subscription pattern for performance. When no handlers are subscribed, no per-node subscriptions are maintained. Once a handler subscribes, the Graph automatically subscribes to all existing nodes' BoundsChanged events and manages subscriptions as nodes are added/removed.

For high-frequency operations like dragging many nodes, consider using explicit invalidation methods instead of relying on this event, as it fires for each individual node change.

NodesChanged

Event raised when nodes are added, removed, or the collection is reset. This is a convenience event derived from Elements.CollectionChanged.

public event NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler? NodesChanged

Event Type

NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler

ShapesChanged

Event raised when shapes are added, removed, or the collection is reset. This is a convenience event derived from Elements.CollectionChanged.

public event NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler? ShapesChanged

Event Type

NotifyCollectionChangedEventHandler
